amendment.description: To require the Secretary of Energy to establish a Nuclear Fuel Security Program, expand the American Assured Fuel Supply Program, establish an HALEU for Advanced Nuclear Reactor Demonstration Projects Program, and submit a report on a civil nuclear credit program, and to enhance programs to build workforce capacity to meet critical mission needs of the Department of Energy.

action.text: Amendment SA 999 under the order of 7/26/2023, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 96 - 3. Record Vote Number: 202.

Amendment SA 999 proposed by Senator Barrasso to Amendment SA 935. (consideration: CR S3717-3718) To require the Secretary of Energy to establish a Nuclear Fuel Security Program, expand the American Assured Fuel Supply Program, establish an HALEU for Advanced Nuclear Reactor Demonstration Projects Program, and submit a report on a civil nuclear credit program, and to enhance programs to build workforce capacity to meet critical mission needs of the Department of Energy.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 999 proposed by Senator Barrasso to Amendment SA 935.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 999 under the order of 7/26/2023, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 96 - 3. Record Vote Number: 202.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 999 under the order of 7/26/2023, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 96 - 3. Record Vote Number: 202.
